content: I did observe that a DP or memoized solution would be faster but my simple recursive solution runs in a few milliseconds for my inputs anyways
Does anyone knows how to make a global variable in Groovy?
Also, your use of the shift operators is inconsistent
IMO, bit_cast should only be allowed either to std::byte or from std::byte. Nothing else really makes sense.

the names are std::string, std::cin and std::cout.
You need to have a #include <string> and a #include <iostream> at the top of your file, too.

Thanks thats a good bit of options, if I may just before you go to bed. For this:
if elem_r and elem_g are the same type, I would also investigate whether making strong types for the occasion would yield better optimization (by letting the compiler know they cannot alias each other).
I was thinking like making separate types for each channel. If they are the same type, the compiler has to assume they could overlap. That would prevent some optimizations.
ngl living short walking distance from work is such a perk

oh yeah, if you can wfh it's surely optimal
I can't wfh mentally, just don't feel productive when doing things on same desk and same keyboard and same mouse as I used to grind dota in the evening
and I don't have nor want to invest into big flat with a separate office room
